title: Attributes of child elements are not copied if no element description is available (gazebo issue 735)

content.raw:
Migrated from [gazebo issue 735](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issue/735):

Created by @johmeyer 



Attributes of unknown SDF elements (e.g. plugin configuration) should also be copied in the [sdf::copyChildren()](#!/osrf/sdformat/src/7d7b26034a43d88e48d490a660a591d3a6b338c1/src/parser.cc?at=default#cl-735) function in `src/parser.cc`. The current version only copies attributes of elements that have a description.

I am using attributes in some plugin configuration elements and it took me a while to find out why I cannot access them in the plugin's Load() method any more...

I am using Gazebo version 1.5 shipped with groovy. In fuerte, using the old parser_deprecated.cc that has been removed in [d7dbe92b6426674e33891035223605f390599dcb](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/commits/d7dbe92b6426674e33891035223605f390599dcb), having attributes in plugin child elements worked without problems.
content.html:
Migrated from gazebo issue 735:

Created by @johmeyer

Attributes of unknown SDF elements (e.g. plugin configuration) should also be copied in the sdf::copyChildren() function in src/parser.cc. The current version only copies attributes of elements that have a description.

I am using attributes in some plugin configuration elements and it took me a while to find out why I cannot access them in the plugin's Load() method any more...

I am using Gazebo version 1.5 shipped with groovy. In fuerte, using the old parser_deprecated.cc that has been removed in d7dbe92b6426674e33891035223605f390599dcb, having attributes in plugin child elements worked without problems.
